rule.name: Operation pattern
rule.narrative: This rule detects the generation of Java exceptions.

threshold.message: Java exception throwing detected. Please check the applicative logs. This may be false positive if the exception is part of applicative processing like text to number conversion. However, if false positive are frequent, this is then negative performance hit to be reviewed by the application owner. Note that exception generation is 200-700 slower than any code based solution (ex: NumberFormatException vs Guava tryParse).

rule.name: Operation pattern
rule.narrative: This rule detects any intensive generation of Java exceptions which may affect the performance of the application.

threshold.message: Exception generated very often within the action. Check the applicative logs for errors. Review the code as exception generation is performance invasive.
Exception generated very often within the action. Check the applicative logs for errors. Review the code as exception generation is performance invasive.

rule.name: Operation global percentage
rule.narrative: This rule detects any intensive usage of the Java String replace which may affect the performance of the application.

threshold.message: Possible contention on String replacement. String replacement involves regular expression whom initialization is at high cost. You may consider other alternatives like the Apache StringUtils. Fixed in Java 9 (JDK-8058779).

rule.name: Session execution pattern
rule.narrative: This rule detects the possible presence of a Solaris PKCS bug.

threshold.message: Possible JDK bug on PKCS11. System is about to freeze.

rule.name: Active named thread limit
rule.narrative: This rule detects any high number of JMX connection threads.

threshold.message: High number of JMX connection threads. Possible thread leak.

rule.name: Operation parallel contention
rule.narrative: This rule detects any contention on completion of Future tasks.

threshold.message: Important and long long wait on the completion of tasks. Please check the system state health.
Important wait on the completion of tasks.

rule.name: Operation parallel contention
rule.narrative: This rule detects any random generation number slowness.

threshold.message: Long wait on random generation number. Either system entropy may be low (especially under Linux VM in which case entropy generators can be used) or JDK8 bug (JDK-8098581) fixed in 1.8.121+ or system is under high load. Please check the system state health.

rule.name: Operation parallel contention
rule.narrative: This rule detects the JDK8 bug (JDK-8075006).

threshold.message: Threads accessing a weak hash map get stuck by looping endlessly and consuming therefore high CPU. JDK8 bug (JDK-8075006) supposed to be fixed, or system is under high load. Recommendation is to make this hash map access thread safe. Please check the system state health.

rule.name: Operation global percentage
rule.narrative: This rule detects any important usage of Java reflection.

threshold.message: Important usage of Java introspection. Review the code to possibly cache the introspection results.

rule.name: Operation global percentage
rule.narrative: This rule detects any IP lookup slowness which could be due to DNS issues.

threshold.message: Frequent IP lookup detected : DNS resolution is probably very slow. Please make sure that remote hosts are declared in the local host file. Check also the DNS resolution performance.

rule.name: Operation presence
rule.narrative: This rule detects the usage of the deprecated HashTable class.

threshold.message: HashTable is deprecated class. Prefer ConcurrentHashMap for better performance.

rule.name: Operation presence
rule.narrative: This rule detects the usage of the deprecated Vector class.

threshold.message: Vector is deprecated class. Prefer synchronized ArrayList for better performance.

rule.name: Operation pattern
rule.narrative: This rule detects any garbage collection execution.

threshold.message: Force Garbage Collection detected : bad practice. Must be disabled if possible.

rule.name: Operation pattern
rule.narrative: This rule detects any Java virtual machine exit execution.

threshold.message: JVM exit call detected. Check any task sequence to make sure that no other important task was running at that time.

rule.name: Operation global percentage
rule.narrative: This rule detects any HTTP slowness which could be due to DNS issues, or remote HTTP server under load or sending back large pages/data.

threshold.message: Frequent HTTP response wait detected : DNS resolution could be very slow or remote HTTP server is under load or generating high volume of data. For the DNS, please make sure that remote hosts are declared in the local host file. Check also the DNS resolution performance. Verify the remote HTTP server state.

rule.name: Operation presence
rule.narrative: This rule detects the usage of the java.util.Random constructor which is not recommended for security reasons.

threshold.message: java.util.Random constructor should not be used. Prefer java.security.SecureRandom for security reasons.

rule.name: Operation global percentage
rule.narrative: This rule detects any intensive usage of the Java Class forName method which may affect the performance of the application.

threshold.message: Possible contention on the Class forName method. Class lookup can be at high cost due to lock contention at class loader level. Desired class may be missing or functionality design could be reviewed to prevent this frequent call.

rule.name: Operation pattern
rule.narrative: This rule detects the failure of method introspection.

threshold.message: Java introspection failure detected. This may be false positive if the exception is part of applicative processing. However, if false positive are frequent, this is then negative performance hit to be reviewed by the application owner. Note that exception generation is 200-700 slower than any code based solution.

rule.name: Function pattern
rule.narrative: This rule detects the JVM dispatching of uncaught exceptions.

threshold.message: A thread died due to an uncaught exception. The JVM did catch the originating Java exception and forwarded it to a default handler. Often, this is an uncaught Error such as OutOfMemoryError or StackOverflowError. You should inspect the logs for exception traces and understand the root cause. Review also the application code to handle properly such exception. Note that the exception processing is performed in the initial thread : check its name.

rule.name: Operation pattern
rule.narrative: This rule detects the bundle missing resource errors.

threshold.message: Java bundle missing resource detected. Please check the applicative logs. Make sure that the application can access all its resources.

rule.name: Operation global percentage
rule.narrative: This rule detects any intensive usage of Java regular expressions.

threshold.message: Possible contention on regular expressions. You may ask the R&D to review it.
Important contention on regular expressions. Please ask the R&D to review it and see if it can be improved.
High contention on regular expressions. Some regular expression is probably not optimal. Please ask the R&D to review it and see if it can be improved.
JVM shutdown is slow. You may investigate any performance issue there.

rule.name: Operation parallel contention
rule.narrative: This rule detects contention on the file system access through the ZipFileSystemProvider.

threshold.message: Threads accessing files through the ZipFileSystemProvider get locked on an internal synchronized map.

rule.name: Operation pattern
rule.narrative: This rule detects the incompatibility of Java libraries.

threshold.message: Incompatibility between 2 libraries is detected. An action is probably failing due to this error : inspect the logs. This may due to classpath issues where an unexpected library gets loaded first. You may run the JVM with the -verbose to look at the loaded classes when the issue happens.
